p.span: Dance means so much to my life
it has taught me a lot
Besides becoming a professional person within dance,
it has taught me to grow as a human, as a person, as a being in general.
I have such a personal relationship with dance.
I can tell for 100%, that it's a part of me.
I am like a bartender, going over there.
I'll introduce myself, my name is Aron Mitu
we've organized this workshop today as Riddim Dance
and we hope you'll like it
I wasn't led to be a teacher or a dancer at all
I wasn't led that way at all
It started from my love to music
I liked music videos, recording them, etc
Parties, where people saw me dancing
they have liked it
and I slowly got into that dance world until it did become
my profession eventually.

n

That's why people study dance

educational and all kinds of other forms
This is dance
and it is up to the person how he spreads it further
because he can choose the form it suits him
Behind everything I have achived with dance is Riddim Dance
In the Riddim Dance project you can find the adult Mitu

and it is purely about a dance school
that deals with dancehall

as a person looking the way I look..

I went to primary and secondary school here
and I really experienced that
that very important period for a person in general
I have experienced it here in Slovakia
Which means that
I know Slovak people, whether they are children
it doesn't matter, I know them, I mean from my perspective
but for a long time it was like why do they look at me
and why am I so strange for some people
I've been asking that question all the time
When our mission is that we really want to take care of the others
they will perceive us that way
because
they are processing that energy
And once that energy is positive and ready to expand
it will work
we have great time together

going to hype like this

just put the music on.

This is a saucer in my opinion
You know, for a small cup
This one is called Jebena.
You can prepare a coffee in it
Original coffee
In Ethiopia they do a coffee session,
like a whole ceremony starting with green coffee
you wash it, roast it, grind it
then you fill it with warm water, add ground coffee
and it's prepared on the coals until it starts to boil
and you have to keep an eye on it
because when it starts to boil it also starts to building a foam and
you have to take it off the fire so it doesn't boil
In Slovakia we were taught in primary school 6th grade
That first man on Earth was from Ethiopia
as a human
Ethiopia is one of the oldest countries in Slovakia... hehe, in the world
For example, Haile Selassie, I know a bit more about this,
was the king thanks to whom Ethiopia won over Italy in WWII
and therefore remained as an uncolonized country in Africa.
I guess it was the only one country, or one more besides the others.
In Ethiopia, if we are talking about culture, the most famous is dance
Eskista dance,
you move a lot with your arms and with your chest

I am looking for the good inside of people, their positivity
Even if they act strangely or being negative or
acting the way I do not like
I still try to see the good in them and wait for that moment when it passes
And everything is suddenly good
I don't want to talk too much about what's wrong with people
When do I feel in harmony?
When I can do what I do in a way that makes me happy
and I have time for my family and loved ones
That's when harmony happens for me
It is not happening when I'm unbalanced
- that's not what harmony means to me.
Harmony gone.
And what is love to me?
God
That's love to me. Everything good what we do.. is love
How we try to help each other, create good
The word “good” means love to me.
